title: On Quantified Observability Analysis in Multiagent Systems. (arXiv:2310.02614v1 [cs.AI])
abstract: In multiagent systems (MASs), agents' observation upon system behaviours may improve the overall team performance, but may also leak sensitive information to an observer. A quantified observability analysis can thus be useful to assist decision-making in MASs by operators seeking to optimise the relationship between performance effectiveness and information exposure through observations in practice. This paper presents a novel approach to quantitatively analysing the observability properties in MASs. The concept of opacity is applied to formally express the characterisation of observability in MASs modelled as partially observable multiagent systems. We propose a temporal logic oPATL to reason about agents' observability with quantitative goals, which capture the probability of information transparency of system behaviours to an observer, and develop verification techniques for quantitatively analysing such properties. We implement the approach as an extension of the PRISM model checke

translated_title: 关于多Agent系统中可量化的可观察性分析
translated_abstract: 在多Agent系统中，Agent对系统行为的观察可能改善整体团队的表现，但也可能向观察者泄露敏感信息。因此，可量化的可观察性分析可以帮助操作员在实践中通过观察来优化性能效果和信息暴露之间的关系，以辅助决策。本文提出了一种在多Agent系统中定量分析可观察性属性的新方法。我们将不透明度的概念应用于正式表达建模为部分可观测多Agent系统的可观察性特征。我们提出了一种用于推理Agent可观察性的时间逻辑oPATL，并开发了验证技术来定量分析这些属性。我们将该方法作为PRISM模型检测器的扩展实现。
tldr: 本文针对多Agent系统提出了一种可量化的可观察性分析方法。通过引入不透明度概念和时间逻辑oPATL，我们可以定量分析系统行为对观察者的信息透明度，从而为操作员辅助决策提供帮助。
en_tdlr: This paper presents a novel approach to quantitatively analyze the observability properties in multiagent systems. By introducing the concept of opacity and the temporal logic oPATL, the paper provides a quantitative analysis of the transparency of system behaviors to observers, assisting decision-making in practice.
